title: U.S. to sue China at WTO for alleged trade violations: WSJ
text: March 22, 2018 / 1:36 PM / Updated an hour ago U.S. to sue China at WTO for alleged trade violations: WSJ Reuters Staff 1 Min Read WASHINGTON (Reuters) - The Unites States is expected to sue China at the World Trade Organization over alleged trade law violations as part of its planned trade announcement later on Thursday, the Wall Street Journal reported, citing a person with knowledge of the plans. Flags of U.S. and China are placed for a meeting between Secretary of Agriculture Sonny Perdue and China's Minister of Agriculture Han Changfu at the Ministry of Agriculture in Beijing, China June 30, 2017. REUTERS/Jason Lee/Files Planned U.S. tariffs on China could also hit $50 billion of Chinese imports, the Journal said, citing the individual. Reporting by Susan Heavey; Editing by Bernadette Baum
